_prev_prog_3.Description:
Associated Food Stores is in compliance with the OSHA Standard 29CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals.

Administrative and Engineering controls in place that would mitigate or reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia.
*  Electronic ammonia detection in the compressor room, non-smoking hallway and the glycol areas.
*  Ammonia detection control system sets off local audible alarms and activates room ventilation systems.
*  Detection control system will also auto telephone dial key facility personnel in the event of leak detection.
*  High and low level switches/alarms and written operating procedures prevent abnormal, or hazardous operating conditions within the pressure vessels and remaining refrigeration system.
*  Safety relief valves are configured to all pressure vessels, condensers and compressor oil separators to eliminate the potential of over pressurization of those associated pieces of equipment.
*  Refrigeration operators are on duty 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
*  Operators make daily periodic rounds and maintain computer log entries to track equipment status.
*  Periodic maintenance program is in place to ensure the entire refrigeration system is maintained in optimum operational and mechanical condition at all times.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1) Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Associated Food Stores complies with applicable federal, state and local regulations. All employees are informed of hazards in the workplace. Employees who work with potentially hazardous substances receive proper training in the handling of those substances. This facility has procedures in place to safely remove employees from areas in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance release were to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and response procedures.



2) Facility and Regulated Substances



This facility is located in Farr West, UT.   Processed food is stored at this location.  Food ingredients are received, packaged, and shipped.  The regulated substance at this facility, anhydrous ammonia, is used in a closed-loop refrigeration system for product cooling and freezing.  Ammonia is the most effective, energy efficient and environmentally safe chemical for keeping food at its proper temperature.



3) General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention



This location complies with the OSHA Process Safety Management for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standard relative to anhydrous ammonia. Therefore, this facility has programs to ensure proper operation and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  Further, refrigeration system operators have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the refrigeration system. 



The ammonia refrigeration system at this facility has been designed and constructed using good engineering practices and conforms to industry standards.  The system includes ammonia detection devices, an emergency shutdown switch located outside the main mechanical room, high- and low-level switches in pressure vessels, and safety relief valves piped into a diffusion system to avert serious system overpressure.  Periodic maintenance on the refrigeration system is managed using a computerized maintenance management

system.  Annual physical system audits are performed by an external refrigeration contractor to ensure system integrity. 



4) Five Year Accident History



During the past five years this facility has had no accidental release of ammonia.  



5) Emergency Response Program



This facility has procedures in place to respond defensively to the release of a hazardous substance. Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a). Coordination with the local fire department is initiated during an emergency situation.



6) Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Associated Food Stores expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of their PSM/RMP Program.



All recommendations developed during the PHA and the audit were designed to improve the safety performance of the ammonia refrigeration process.  Associated Food Stores expects to evaluate each recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of an unintentional release.
